intro: Persoonia elliptica, commonly known as the narrow-leaved geebung, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its narrow, elliptical leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in heathlands and open forests, preferring well-drained soils. Persoonia elliptica is often found in regions with a Mediterranean climate, such as southern Western Australia and the south-west of Western Australia. It is a shrub that can reach up to 2 meters in height, with a dense, compact growth habit.
